Reviews.Title: “As all the other reviews say...it's the location!”
Reviews.Author: stl_cardinals
Reviews.Content: This is a relatively affordable place with great location. It lacks the bells and whistles of some of the boutique places but it is clean, spacious and fulfills the traveler needs. Front desk was friendly. The free wifi and nice size gym were a plus. The pull down blinds that attach to the window sill were great for sleeping in without sunlight peeking through. Only minor downsides were that our TV reception was bad, and our fridge didn't cool. We had them replace the fridge with another, but that didn't get much cooler. Not a big deal for us, but may be for someone storing food in there. Like everyone else says, the location is pretty much unbeatable. Central to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, convenient for business meetings”
Reviews.Author: 3ecrm
Reviews.Content: Very central location, easily accessible, close to public transportation, and close to downtown corporate offices, shopping, sightseeing, with plenty restaurants nearby. Room is of decent size, nicely appointed, with electronic window covering, which is quite nice and less dusty comparing to cloth ones.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: the_lowdown
Reviews.Content: Location - excellent downtown location just off Michigan Ave. Walking distance to the Navy Pier (20 min), Millenium Park (20 min) and just minutes from endless shopping and eating options. Room - clean...and stayed clean the entire stay despite the 3 of us being a little messy with our clutter and snacks. There was a king sized bed and a comfortable sofabed (believe it or not!). The room was fairly small and our 8th floor view was of the roof (nothing scenic) but at least it was quiet. Facilties - did not get to take advantage of the gym or pool. But did frequent the Starbucks attached to the Hotel often. Staff - loved the front desk people. They were super friendly and helpful when we asked for directions, info regarding airport shuttle, good steakhouses, etc. As well, the valet guys were also very friendly. It did sometimes take more than 15 min to get the car but I guess that can't be helped. Value - excellent for this ideal downtown location. We had a car rental and considering overnight parking is almost half the cost of the room, this part doesn't seem worth it. But it seems this is the going rate everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Really Good for the Price”
Reviews.Author: DRY_72
Reviews.Content: I spent President's Day weekend in Chicago and I booked a room here for a very reasonable rate. The rooms are a bit on the small side and the bathroom sink area is really tight. Also, the ceilings in the rooms are a bit low. However, if I wanted a more luxurious room, it would have cost a lot more money elsewhere. The room itself was clean and it has free internet. Additionally, the service here is great. The people working the check-in area are really nice and professional. Also, I managed to leave a jacket in the closet and by the end of the week, it was sent to my house.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Jwudgy
Reviews.Content: Ideal location for family trip. Easy walking to mag mile, water tower, navy pier. Garretts popcorn right next door.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for us.”
Reviews.Author: MartiniWisconsin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Courtyard River North for three nights. Great location for us, near some good food and drinks. Room was great. Clean and comfy. King size bed was very good. All of the staff was very friendly and helpful. Especially "Ron" one of the front door men.

Reviews.Title: “If you want a hotel in river north this is it!”
Reviews.Author: fabulous990
Reviews.Content: Great location on Hubbard, walking distance to everything in river north and so close to magnificient mile.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff, Terrible Night Sleep”
Reviews.Author: MWorth79
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are Marriott rewards members and have the Marriott Visa, we received a free night and decided to use it for a nice Valentine's Day weekend. We usually stay at the Courtyard Magnificent Mile, however that hotel was full. We chose this Courtyard because of its great location! Very near to great restaurants, bars, shopping, etc. Also fairly near Navy Pier, which was good for us as we had tickets to the Shakespeare Theatre. Our arrival was great, the valets were very polite and friendly, the desk staff were friendly and efficient. The elevators were a bit slow and of the 3 elevators, one seemed to be perpetually stuck on the lower level. The room was pretty standard, king size bed, small sofa, desk, decent size bathroom. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. We were on the 7th floor, so you would think it was high enough to not hear the street noise. However, I did not sleep at all. The windows were very thin and we faced State Street, which is very busy. Also there must be a fire station or it is the route to a hospital because as other reviewers have mentioned, there were sirens at least once an hour which kept me awake. I could not hear other guests at all, which was nice, but the outside noise was bad. The State Street bread company and Starbucks were very convenient and the breakfast was good. Another thing that bothered us had to do with housekeeping. Check out is Noon and we had the "do not disturb" sign on the door. At around 10:00 there is a knock on the door...housekeeping. She didn't even wait for my husband to get to the door before trying to open it!! What is the point of having the sign on the door if they are going to ignore it, and it was 2 hours prior to check out. I could understand if it was close to noon or after noon and maybe they thought someone had accidentally left the sign on, but we still had 2 hours. The positives are that this is a great location and the valets and front desk staff were very pleasant and efficient. The noise from the street really does this hotel in, and we will probably not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “All around good place when visiting Chicago...”
Reviews.Author: RobHarley
Reviews.Content: I had not stayed at this location before and was pleasantly surprised. Easy parking right next door. Easy check in and front desk was very knowledgeable and eager to talk and help. Lauren S. helped us and pointed us in the right direction and gave us coupons for dinner. Room was nice and hotel was secure using card keys to get in and use of elevator. Breakfast was good and Greg our server was great! I will go back! Thanks Management, we had noticed that you were keeping a eye on everything that was going on. Hotel and restaurant both.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very pleased!”
Reviews.Author: travelindevo
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with this hotel! It's in such a great location, and we got a great deal on our room. We expected a standard room, but were pleasantly surprised to get a suite! The room was clean and comfortable. The employees were helpful and courteous. Overall, a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great price in January!!”
Reviews.Author: jam536
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in mid-January, when Chicago had an abnormal warm front. Originally had planned to stay 1 night, however I had to book another night once I checked out. They were able to book me back in the same exact room! The front desk was so nice, parking was easy, and the junior suite was perfect! The price was very, very reasonable for the Magnificent Mile. Would definitely return!! I love Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “I highly recommend staying at this property!”
Reviews.Author: lorinjess
Reviews.Content: My friend and I took our 19 year old daughters to Chicago for some after holiday shopping and eating. We chose the Courtyard because we are Marriott rewards people HOWEVER, I will only stay at this location when I visit the city! It is in a perfect location at the corner of Ontario and St. Clair - a half of a block from Michigan Avenue. The front desk staff were the friendliest I have ever encountered. They always greeted us and asked if we needed help, directions, anything. BUT the high point of the stay was the Bell Captain/Concierge, Neil. He was the best doorman/concierge I have experienced in my numerous travels. He was full of knowledge, knew tons of people, told lots of stories and made great recommendations that he followed up on and made reservations for. He was the high lite of the trip!! I highly recommend staying at this property

Reviews.Title: “Great choice in downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: guy4travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Courtyard in Chicago in December. We had a number of activities planned and this hotel made it easy. It is centrally located- easy walking distance to shopping, the river and the theatre district. If your plans take you out of downtown, there is an L stop just two blocks away. The room was quite large with a refrigerator and a really comfortable bed. The front desk staff was also very helpful- great choice for a downtown stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SpiderUR05
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Courtyard for 3 nights in November to attend a friend's wedding. We picked the Courtyard for its location near the reception site, and for the price. We didn't go wrong with either. The hotel is located within super easy walking distance to attractions on both sides of the the river, from Michigan Ave. and the Navy Pier to the museums and Millennium Park. The hotel itself was very clean and comfortable. The staff were all extremely helpful and pleasant, the rooms were well kept and we didn't have any problems while there. If we were ever to go back to Chicago, I would definitely consider the Courtyard Downtown again.

Reviews.Title: “our new Chicago hotel favorite..”
Reviews.Author: HoosierGirl522
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our family of four for a long New Year's Weekend. The rooms were comfortable and large enough for our family, even with a pull-out sofa bed. The beds lack a warm blanket of any kind, next time we will request blankets. The Starbucks is small but so convenient that is in the lobby. The lobby is always busy, always difficult to walk around avoiding people. The lobby needed to be twice the size to accommodate everyone. The restaurant offers a great Wisconsin cheese tray and a nice wine selection. They also had live music on New Years Eve which was excellent! We have stayed many places in Chicago. This is our new favorite for the price and the location! It is very convenient to go back and forth to the hotel many times during a shopping day. When you pay for parking, don't forget to get the discount from the front desk before departing.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Downtown Location-Near Excellent Restaurants”
Reviews.Author: ExperiencedWarrior
Reviews.Content: 3 Night Stay in December 2011. Have stayed here before. 15 story, well-maintained Marriott Courtyard Inn property. Staff is very pleasant. Rates are reasonable for downtown Chicago. There are great weekend deals! Very convenient to numerous excellent restaurants and shopping all within easy walking distance. Overnight parking is expensive (no worse than anyplace else in downtown Chicago) but anyone considering a stay might want to think about arriving/departing by train and using cabs for the few times they might be needed. No complaints, just one suggestion for the hotel: Provide guests with one free bottled water or none at all instead of putting 2 in the rooms at $3.50ea. The 7-11 around the corner sells water for 2 for $2 so $3.50each doesn't come across well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ReneeIllinois
Reviews.Content: This is the second year my friends and I have stayed at the Courtyard for our "girls" weekend. The location is great! Close to Michigan Ave, Navy Pier and State Street. The staff is very helpful. Rooms are nice size and beds are comfy. There is a Starbucks in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for a few weeks and would definitely go back”
Reviews.Author: lifelongtravelr
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure how anyone can criticize this place. We had a one bedroom suite and loved it. Free breakfasts which were great and free evening snacks and occasionally beer as well. The rooms are clean. It's next door to hub 51 which is a great restaurant and night spot. If you're looking for a fun night out you are in the middle of the river north scene. The weight room is nice and but for the loud kids the pool would've been great. The staff was nice. The one thing to try to avoid is parking because that costs about 30-45 bucks. Thats about a third of the room price so take the train from the airport and figure out how get there without a car. You won't need one once you arrive since you're in the middle of a great part of the city. Anyone who has bad comments probably doesn't really understand what a great deal this place is.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the big city!”
Reviews.Author: imtigg2
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed in this location. The staff, service, location, and overall atmosphere was terrific! You cannot go wrong if you stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed....”
Reviews.Author: Sarah G
Reviews.Content: Booked a 1 bedroom suite for a weekend getaway with my family. As others have mentioned the noise is horrible. None of us got a decent sleep during our trip and I'm used to noise at hotels because I travel a lot for business. I understand this is a Downtown location but the windows are paper thin. The phone crackled even when trying to call the front desk. I ordered the Disney On Demand package for my kids which didn't work after watching one show. I booked the Escape package where my kids were supposed to eat free for breakfast, lunch and dinner only to find out the restaurant is only open for breakfast this time of year. We had a menu for room service in our room only to find out Room Service is not offered this time of year. The website says there is a nearby trolley to take you to Navy Pier, only to find out the trolley does not run this time of year. The staff was friendly, especially the bellman but I will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “For a short business stay”
Reviews.Author: Hakke
Reviews.Content: Dear All, Because of professional reasons, I staid in Courtyard hotel in Chicago from 25 th november until 1st december. The room was large and correct but not such modern one. Breakfasts were poor and unappetazing. Service was looking friendly but only commercial. I won't recommand this hotel except for location not far from the center. Thank you Best Regards

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location, friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: BabaKay
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our recent stay at the Courtyard Downtown. Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful with directions. Our room was clean and comfortable. Great location and would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Dennis D
Reviews.Content: Getaway weekend with family - very convenient to shopping. Staff was friendly and accommodating. - Restaurant could use a menu update but plenty of other choices to eat nearby. Room satisfactory and clean. Pool and exercise room were adequate and clean. no issues or complaints. would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “4 star at a 2 star price”
Reviews.Author: Tra S
Reviews.Content: The employees and facilities were excellent. This is my first choice of hotels for my next trip back to Chicago. The location is perfect for walking to all tourist attractions. The rooms were nice and the staff was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Good marks from this Gold Elite Member, sans decent Wi-Fi”
Reviews.Author: Buckles2007
Reviews.Content: Great location. Close to everything downtown. A very personable and friendly staff. The rooms are smaller than the average Courtyard, but with a more contemporary design. A comfortable lobby, spacious cafe and in-property Starbucks (would benefit from the Marriott "Bistro" makeover). The Fitness Center has a spa, lap pool, sauna and ample equipment, but could use better lighting and air conditioning (this is shared with the neighboring residents). My only disappointment is the lack of in-room Wi-Fi (my first Courtyard without in years) and the lack of Wi-Fi bandwidth in the common areas (i.e., very slow). Enjoying our Thanksgiving weekend stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay especially during busy Chicago time!”
Reviews.Author: Jennmw
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the Chicago marathon - what a busy time and hotels are very crowded! It was a great location and they were especially helpful for those running races, putting out bananas and showing where the buses pull in right across the street for those needing to go to the expo etc. It's a great location for shopping, just a few minutes from Michigan Avenue. I've stayed at both the Marriott and Courtyard, and for the price, this one is just as good as that one. I'd highly recommend it and will stay here again. Parking is right next door and a bit cheaper if you are staying at the hotel, around 25 a night vs. 40. We didn't find it too small at all for the two of us, having a king bed. I can see where it might be small for a family, but can only comment on how our room was set up, which was plenty of room.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay in Downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: TomBezig
Reviews.Content: We were in Chicago last summer (July 2011) and wanted to be in the middle of it all to enjoy everything the city has to offer. This hotel has easy access coming and going to the highway, and is one block (100m) from the Magnificent Mile and a couple of blocks from Lake Michigan. There are great restaurants, like the Sayat Nova Armenian Restaurant, 50m from the hotel. The attached restaurant had an excellent breakfast buffet and served excellent coffee (not the normal watered-down restaurant coffee you see so often in the US). The best Chicago popcorn, Garrett Popcorn, is right next door. We were lucky, and even saw the Chicago Airshow while we were there. OK... so the location is perfect... now the room. The room was very comfortable, clean and quiet. There's really no much more to add, because that is all I am looking for in a hotel room. As an added benefit, the room setup was a little different that in standard hotels in the the bed faced out towards the huge picture window... a welcomed change. The decor was upscale to the point that I forgot I was in a Courtyard, but rather in a small, privately-owned hotel in Key West. The internet worked, and it was included in the price. All in all, we were very happy with the room. Taxi service is offered by the bellman, and it is a short ride to museums, Rush St. or wherever you want to go. Marshall-Fields (now Macy's) is leisurely 15 minute walk from the hotel, and the Rush Street jazz & blues clubs are about a 20 minute walk. Don't forget the Rosebud on Rush for a fine Italian meal... it's a Chicago landmark. I highly recommend this hotel for your stay in downtown Chicago. I had absolutely no complaints at all with my stay, and it was a perfect weekend.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but not great”
Reviews.Author: mrspmc00
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for our 11th Anniversary. We normally stay at the Courtyard off of Michigan Ave. This hotel has a GREAT location for dining/nightlife. Tons of great restaurants and pubs within a few blocks. The shopping areas on MI Ave and State St are also within walking distance. The room was smaller than most Courtyards we have been in, and the air conditioning system was hard to regulate. It'd be hot in the room and then 10 minutes later we'd be freezing. Hotel was modern and clean, and the staff was all friendly. It was not a bad stay, just not a great stay. We'll go back to the Courtyard off of MIchigan Ave next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the price”
Reviews.Author: abmartin71
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located close to both Mag Mile and State Street shopping. It is moderately priced and very clean. The staff is both friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice room”
Reviews.Author: beavertontim
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights for a convention. Excellent location with many restaurants and grocery stores nearby. Felt like a very safe area. The room was very comfortable. No wifi, but the wired connection wa very fast. The staff went out of their way to make sure I felt welcomed and well taken care of. Easy walk from the Blue Line CTA coming in from O'Hare.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - but needs some updating...”
Reviews.Author: wanderlust978
Reviews.Content: The location was fantastic, but I was shocked to find that a hotel in 2011 that charges these prices does not offer wifi in their rooms, which was really inconvenient as I had a lot of work I needed to do. The rooms were clean with a good view, but expect a lot of noise sleeping in the city - the windows are not very good sound barriers. The food ordered from room service was pretty inedible so would not recommend the hotel for food, but it is right next to some fabulous restaurants. The staff was incredibly nice and helpful, but this hotel needs some updating. Also watch out for the $4 water bottles in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for downtown work”
Reviews.Author: acoulter
Reviews.Content: Room was comfortable. Internet is wired only, a disadvantage for me. Restaurant was marginal and bar expensive and sparse. But the location is great for eating elsewhere. Value stay.

Reviews.Title: “One of the better Courtyard's I have stayed at”
Reviews.Author: marine2531
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights while working at both Midway and O'Hare airport. The rooms were nice and clean. The staff was very friendly. Great location a block from Michigan Ave, a few blocks west of Navy Pier. There are a ton of restaurants in the area within walking distance. I had lunch at State Street Bread company and although i felt it was a bit expensive, it was very good. Also had dinner one night at the restaurant. The burger was good. The bartender has a great personality and is very friendly. I was on the 11th floor not facing the street and I still heard the sirens loud and clear. But I must have been pretty tired because I didn't hear anything at night. There is a Starbucks on-site and there is a small convenience area where you can buy drinks, snacks, toiletries and beers. I did order room service one night and my food arrived promptly and hot. O'Hare is a 45 minute train ride from the hotel on the Blue line, which is a 10 minute walk from the hotel. Very convenient. Midway is about 35 minute train ride on the Orange line, but that's not very close to the hotel. If your traveling to or from the city during either rush hour period, you definitely need to take the train. The traffic is HORRENDOUS and will take easily an hour and a half to get to O'Hare and an hour to get to Midway and vice versa. Wired internet connection in the room I found to be extremely slow. That was quite annoying. The A/C worked like a charm. And as you'll see in most of my reviews, the pillows left something to be desired. I just like them firm. There was a love seat and an ottoman in the room which was great for watching TV. There is an area in the lobby that you can use to check in for your flights and print boarding passes. Love that hotels have these things now in case the airport doesn't have mobile boarding pass capabilities. There is a 7-Eleven right across the street as well in case you need to pick anything up. All in all, I liked the Courtyard downtown and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Marriott Standards”
Reviews.Author: VernonCT
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three days for a conference we were having in town. The good - 1. The room was clean 2. The staff was (fairly) friendly 3. Starbucks downstairs The bad - 1. If you are coming here to sleep. GOOD LUCK. As others have said, the noise is pretty bad. I was on the 8th floor and I could hear people on the street talking at 2AM like they were right in my room. The sirens were going all night long too. NOT a good nights sleep on any night there. 2. As others too have said, good luck finding a working ice machine. Mine did not work and I called the desk and they said it would be fixed right away. Needless to say it wasn't and secondly another reviewer made that comment over a month ago. They should put a sign on it is so people know instead of pretending this is new information. 3. Pool / Fitness center. Not sure who designed this one but they put the hot tub right in the entryway to the pool and fitness center. So, if you enjoy a steady stampede of people walking by you was you try to relax, then you are in luck!! I did not see one person using it the entire time and I suspect that is why. The fitness center was AWFUL. First of all, there was no airconditioning. The 76 degree air from outside was actually cooling the place down. I called the front desk and they said someone would come right up. An hour later, no one was there. All three days I was there it was sweltering, smelly and stuffy. The free weights often had no match ( the 10 lb weight just had one ) and the place was DIRTY. I know that dried sweat sitting on machines for days is not up to the Marriott standards. Last issue was cell phone use. For some reason ( the hotel staff couldn't quite figure it out ) you can't get a signal in the lobby or most of the rooms. 3 people I was traveling with with different carriers had the same issue and the front desk told me that I had to go out by the road to make a call. Uh really?? It was very frustrating. I had a 20 minute work call that I couldn't make in my room, so I went to the lobby only to have to stand in the rain to make the call outside. Overall, I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Russelljack
Reviews.Content: This hotel was located within a five minute walk of Michigan Ave, the Downtown Loop and a good selection of restaurants. It was a three block walk to the Blue train Line which takes you to Chicago O'Hare airport directly, and very importantly the station has escalators and lifts. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, nothing was too much trouble. The room was very clean and comfortable especially the King size bed.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is just what I wanted.”
Reviews.Author: veracraig
Reviews.Content: I saved $280 by staying here (two nights) compared to other hotels on the Miracle Mile in Chicago. We were greeted by a friendly doorman and front desk staff. Our room was very clean and quiet. The subway was about 4 blocks away which took us all over the city and north to Evanston. Shopping, dining, etc. are all close by.

Reviews.Title: “Overall great - but one complaint”
Reviews.Author: sal403
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel was fantastic! Everyone was so friendly and helpful. They didn't hesitate to get reservations for us, to provide site-seeting advice, and even to provide special pillows. The hotel itself is in a fantastic location that's close to everything -- restaurants, entertainment, the river, shopping. We felt completely safe walking near the building both day and night. A couple of favourite spots include: Cantina Laredo (delicious fresh guacamole made right at your table), Giordano's (best deep dish pizza), House of Blues (great music), Gibson's (THE best steak - bar none - that we've ever had)! My one complaint is the noise from the nearby fire hall. The sirens woke us up at least once each night (sometimes 2 or 3 times -- ugh!) and I sleep VERY deeply. If you're a light sleeper, this is not the hotel for you. I invested in a set of ear plugs which helped. Other than that -- I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great central location, large room & coffee in room :)”
Reviews.Author: mikesterDublin
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights here at the start of an American trip and was very impressed with this hotel. The hotel is in a very central location, near the main shopping and sightseeing street (Michigan Avenue I think). There are loads of good shops and restraunts and bars near the hotel - just a short stroll away. The lady at reception who checked me in , was very friendly and welcoming, and gave me lots of free maps and stuff about the city which was really helpful. The room I had was very large and had a great view over the city through panoramic windows along one wall. There was a giant bed, and also a comfortable sofa, and a large TV with a good selection of channels. There was also a coffee making machine in the room, with sachets of coffee. Everything was clean and very well maintained. Another good feature of this hotel was that there was 2 free computers in the reception area with free internet. The staff on reception were most helpful and friendly any time I asked if I could use these computers. I didn't hear any noise leaking in from other rooms or the corridor, and slept very well here both nights. I found the location excellent, as I walked to the hotel from the State and Lake metro station (from where you can get the Blue line to and from O'Hare airport). This hotel was a great start to my American trip, and I hope I can return there the next time I visit Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Location... location... LOCATION!”
Reviews.Author: ches_p22
Reviews.Content: If you want to be at heart of the bars/restaurants area in Chicago, this is your place. Went here with two friends to enjoy what Chicago has to offer and this was a perfect location. Walking distance to Rush St, bars and restaurants. You can walk to all the Chicago staples... Gino's, Giordano's, Portillo's, and the subway... I travel a lot for work and have come very familiar with Marriotts everywhere... and like most of them, this place is consistent. Clean, quiet, nice bar area, easy check-in, friendly staff... All good.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this place on weekends”
Reviews.Author: bagspacked51
Reviews.Content: The noise from the street outside (including almost constantly honking horns) was deafening until after 2:00 in the morning. We stayed here on a Friday night and will never make that mistake again. Otherwise, it was a standard Courtyard Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest Courtyard ever”
Reviews.Author: 2tampuh2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in the fall and I must say while the hotel itself is your standard Courtyard Marriott the staff were crazy friendly. The concierge asked a bunch of questions and wanted to get to know us, the bell hops are so funny, and will ask how your dinner was or say welcome back or have a great day. The bartender there is hilarious go have one or two drinks before you go out and he will tell you the funniest stories. His mannerisms kept me laughing for ten minutes straight. Really nice guy. The room was decent, bed was good, bathroom was a little outdated and small, they need to reseal that tub. Decent view, fridge in the room, room was on the smaller side and there was only one mirror in the bathroom, difficult if you have two people getting ready. Overall a good stay and the location is a good spot if you want to hit michigan avenue.

Reviews.Title: “Never here Again”
Reviews.Author: Hank18
Reviews.Content: I know Courtyard Marriott brand well but I have never been so disappointed in a Marriott hotel. The service was atrocious. I stayed in this hotel at the beginning of September on a trip to visit colleges with my daughter. I made a reservation for a one bedroom suite since we can't sleep in the same room. I was assured they were available. When I arrived at check in I was informed that my reservation was for a standard room, there were no available suites. The receptionist was rude an blamed the mistake on me, saying I must have have misunderstood.So ridiculous and infuriating. The check in person would do nothing. This was just the beginning of the poor service I faced at every step. Too long to go into here.I got the suite out of the manager but these people were lazy and rude. Don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “"Wait Wait, Don't Tell Me" Trip”
Reviews.Author: ontheroadlesstravele
Reviews.Content: Thank you trip advisor for helping me find this hotel. We were visiting Chicago to attend "Wait Wait, Don't Tell Me" the NPR radio program taped at the Chase Auditorium. The front desk was very welcoming and friendly, and sharing of advice. We appreciated the options they suggested for a great dinner near the show. Quartinos was a wonderful northern Italian tapas style restaurant with a friendly wait staff by the way. We got the corner room we requested online, and the foam pillows. The front desk staff also gave great advice on walking tours to the Navy Pier and other attractions. It is very close to the Magnificent Mile shopping. You get a $9 discount on the adjacent parking garage. It was fun to see the staff dressed in Bears football jerseys Friday, lots of great spirit.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: AlK70
Reviews.Content: Many good restaurants nearby. Room was very clean. Front desk friendly. Some complaints; No wi-fi in rooms. I believe reservation was misleading on this. Wi-fi in public area did work well. We stayed 3 days and hot tub was down the entire stay. Rooms on State St. side can have lots of traffic noise. Ice machine on our floor was down 2 of 3 days. Had to go down two floors to get ice. Restaurant service is slow.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to complain about”
Reviews.Author: kwa829
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my stay here . . clean, comfortable, quiet . . . friendly staff . . . you're not paying for an overdone lobby . . . lots of restaurants nearby . . . internet access is free and good bandwidth . . . really nothing to compain about. Also was very pleased that they let me check in at ~12 Noon.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mr_cruiser
Reviews.Content: Easy walking distance to downtown shops, theatres and river district. This hotel has a swimming pool, gym, restaurant, plus a few 7-11's nearby for late night supplies. Our room was on a higher floor and away from the elevators so it was relatively quiet with a good view. There was a mini-fridge, coffee maker, flat screen, free internet, lots of towels and toiletries, but no microwave or room safe. Check-in and out was fast and efficient, would certainly stay here again. Small tip: Carry a small night-light with you to leave on in the washroom area so that you wouldn't fumble or have an accident when you have to go to the washroom in the night.

Reviews.Title: “Please with the hotel property and the location, not the internet or food”
Reviews.Author: skyeport
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Courtyard Chicago Downtown/River North for nine nights while at a conference, with a couple of extra days for fun. For the most part I was very pleased and thought about giving it five stars. A few minor irritations prevented me. First, the good: The location was great for nightlife, restaurants, and getting around Chicago. I had no problem walking to various train stations to get around the city, and the hotel is a two minute walk from Michigan Avenue and only slightly further to the Loop. The hotel was immaculate and my room cleaned quite well every day. The front desk staff was helpful and friendly, as were the bellhops and housekeeping staff. Perhaps the best part was the room itself was super quiet; I could not near my neighbors at all, which is rare. I really appreciated that! The bed was also very comfortable! You should sleep very well here. The not so good: The internet is incredibly slow, as other reviewers have stated. There were times it was so slow it was unusable. When I needed to get some work done and answer some emails, I found this very aggravating. Another irritation was I had a daily credit at the State State Bread Company on site. The food there is very average, although there is also a Starbucks. When I checked out, at first the credit had not been applied to my room. It is a good thing I looked closely to make sure they applied it to my bill. None of the front desk clerks were very knowledgeable about the credit. I think they should be taught all the various special rates available online to help them answer questions and make checkout smoother. The people working at the State Street Bread Company all seemed unhappy to be there, and on the weekend they are very slow--don't waste your time there, get out and find something yummier and cheaper (or at least yummier!). The hotel was expensive but in line with other prices in Chicago. I would consider staying here again, but only for a pleasure trip when I do not need the internet very much.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, But Expensive, No Safe In Room”
Reviews.Author: Liam T
Reviews.Content: Good Hotel (pretty ordinary), Excellent Location. This is what you are paying for, the location. We were doing route 66 and so had valubles etc and wanted to go out for the night but took most of them out with us as there was no in roon safe. There is safety deposit boxes but I'm a bit of a "don't trust anyone type person, when it comes to going away". Maybe thats an over cautious attitude to have but when paying about $260 US /night I expect a safe as standard in the room. Otherwise a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: psucasey
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is really it's best quality - located a few blocks off Michigan Ave and close to the river, Trump Tower, many hot spots for eating/drinking (Rockit Bar and Grill, Public House, Hub 51, Paris, etc.) we stayed here while in town for Lollapalooza. It was perfect for us - we could walk to Grant Park and to the beach and just about everywhere we wanted to go. Bedding was comfortable and room had a mini-fridge. Nothing else about the hotel was spectacular but the location made it worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: katie112882
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Courtyard Marriot Downtown River North, and had a wonderful experience. The hotel room was very large, very clean, and had the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. The location of the hotel was great as it was a short walk to the Red Line/Grant and a short walk to N. Michigan Ave where you can catch a bus to all major tourist destinations. There are great restaurants within a five minute walk. The staff was mostly friendly, and helpful with transportation routes. I say mostly, because there was one woman with an attitude, but not fair to judge the whole staff based on that one person. The hotel allowed for a late check out as there was severe weather in the morning, and stowed our luggage for the day after the sun came out. There is a cafe downstairs, State St. Bread Co, which has wonderful breakfast, as well as Starbucks. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: JubaFoodTravelFun
Reviews.Content: For a Coutyard, this was impressive. Almost felt full service. Staff extremely friendly & helpful. Rooms clean & updated. Restaurant / Bar great along with Starbucks. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but traffic noise and humidity”
Reviews.Author: RedWingJoe
Reviews.Content: We visited Chicago for 2 days vacation sandwiched around 1 day of work. As Marriotts go this was typical. Room was clean, well maintained, and functional. Comfy bed with lots of pillows. Free internet in room, plus a couple public PCs and printers in the lobby. Very attentive staff at front desk, never had to wait for service, even when others were checking in. No problem getting late check out. Luggage storage after check out also available. Great location - within walking distance (or quick train ride) to everything. Downside to downtown location is nearly constant traffic noise, even from 7 stories up and with white noise from air conditioner running. Surprisingly, we both slept well anyway. Starbucks and another restaurant attached to lobby, but no complimentary breakfast like a Marriott Residents Inn. Lots of great restaurants nearby - check online for mid-week specials. Easy to catch a cab, especially with help of concierge. Cab ride expensive though, and Chicago traffic is typical big-city grid lock. Public transportation (especially multi-day CTS pass) is a bargain. No complimentary shuttle service to/from airport, and CTS blue line is more than a few blocks walk away - doable, but not fun with luggage. CTS red line is just a couple blocks away and Wrigley Field is just a few train stops away (we saw a Cubs game while here). BTW, tickets to watch baseball game from rooftops outside stadium is a pretty good idea on a hot day - it's air conditioned! This was my first visit to Chicago and we brought the heat with us from Virginia. We visited mid-July 2011 in the midst of Chicago's biggest heat wave of the year. Our room was cool, but even with the AC going full blast it always felt humid, especially in the hallways outside the room. Maybe it was from the pool on the 6th floor (we were on 7th), or maybe the AC couldn't handle the heat wave? Speaking of the pool, it's not Olympic size, but it does have a lap lane, but it's not deep enough to turn around. There is a sun deck just outside the pool and there are 2 BBQ grills out there as well. The fitness center is impressive with a half dozen treadmills, a half dozen elliptical machines and an impressive array of weight lifting machines. Only one exercise bike though. The hotel shares its fitness center with an adjoining condo, but I was able to use the equipment without waiting. So in summary - typical Marriott with attentive staff and great location, but there is traffic noise. Easy access to public transportation. Building felt humid, but it may have been because of the heat wave. Pretty impressive fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “nice although a bit noisy along the streets”
Reviews.Author: syh75287
Reviews.Content: It was a nice courtyard marriott and clean. both bathroom and room were very spacious. There's free internet, too. There's a starbucks next to the restaurant located off the lobby and a 7-11 just around the corner. my room came with a king bed, flat-screen tv, sofa and desk area. There's also shelving/panel that runs along the back where the window is for more room to put your stuff on. It's within easy walking distance of the subway (red line) - 2 blks/6 mins. I took the train from the airport to grand & state (with 1 transfer) for $2.25. The red line also takes you to chinatown (cermak stop, southbound from grand) or if you want to eat vietnamese, go northbound to argyle. It's also within walking distance of the magnificent mile. You can walk to heaven on seven for their delicious gumbo and cornbread or ben pao for chinese. you don't need a car, plus it can get very trafficky especially on michigan. i heard sirens one evening and the other night a car revving up and then taking off down the street (zooming sound). It was pretty loud, but I use ear plugs when I go to sleep (and somtimes ambien when I travel) so my sleep was not disturbed.

Reviews.Title: “Liked hotel, good staff, but street noise problems”
Reviews.Author: ErnestGF
Reviews.Content: Like at least one other reviewer noted, there is a problem with street noise. Specifically, constant sirens of emergency vehicles, all night long. The hotel is apparently one block from a fire station. The hotel has individual heating/air-conditioning units, which vent directly outside, and apparently allow considerable noise to enter the room. We live in a far-out suburban neighborhood, and are not accustomed to sirens at all hours. For a city dweller who was accustomed to this kind of noise, this would be a fine, reasonably-priced, hotel. But for us, we won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: FiestaGirlUk
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited this hotel in May 2011. We were most impressed with the hotel, it has a lovely bed and is in a fantastic location and the reception staff seemed really friendly. We did make use of the pool and gym. I noticed that the pool was very busy and children were in there until quite late on (after 10 pm). There were also some children in on their own although there was a sign saying that children until 14 should not be unattended. We noticed that the pool, gym and terrace area seemed to be shared with people living in apartments. We can strongly recommend breakfast at Eatt, just across the road and dinner at Weber Steakhouse just a few blocks up.

Reviews.Title: “We loved personel and stay”
Reviews.Author: Joanie45
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay very much. The staff did everything they could to help us and make our visit to Chicago great. Our thanks to Neil, Kevin, Joanne, Arturo, Estefania, Cederno, and Gaby. Thanks to all at your Lovely hotel at 165 Ontario, Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “There has to be better for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Gmacjr
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights very high priced. Not very clean, the smoke detector was missing from our room, the ice machine did not work. We had a 14th floor room over looking state street, not a good view, some perv on the roof of the building across the street looking at our window at night. Valet 48 a night??? I was not gonna use my car for 2 days, nice bellhop suggested a garage down the street it was 35 a day and not a nice place although my car was ok. It just seems like the hellhole are only willing to help if you pay. No one even offered to help load the car, but we couldn't tell them no when we were unloading. For about 80.00 a night this would have been so so, but it was more than double that so I say look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect family hotel in downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: KMAST5
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in a family room in April - the room was huge & had 2 king size beds & a comfortable double pull out. The staff couldn't have been more helpful & service was second to none. The hotel is so central, just off Magnificent mile, we walked most places & got bus/el passes for other attractions. Good places for breakfast nearby & laundry facilities for free in the hotel. There is a small indoor pool, which was great to relax in after a day on your feet. Excellent value for a family of 5 including 3 teenagers. Loved Chicago & hope to go back - would definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: MLiik
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for while in town to attend a Conference. The hotel was clean & semi modern. The staff was professional and accommodating. The two bell caps were very helpful with receiving fed-ex packages i had sent out ahead of my stay. Overall, not bad for a quick b-trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - great location!”
Reviews.Author: MrDoof
Reviews.Content: We made our trip reservations at the Courtyard by Marriott via Priceline and got a decent rate. The room exceeded our expectations with a large size room and great view of downtown. The location is excellent to restaurants, the El, and the Maginificent Mile. Chicago River and Navy Pier are also pretty close by. The staff was great and allowed us a late check-out since we were taking the train home and that didn't leave until 3pm. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Location - Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: vireshjain
Reviews.Content: Superb Location. Value for money. Located just off Magnificient Mile. Very Friendly Valet and Concierge. Water Tower and Hancock Center a 2 minutes walk. Ice cream - Ghiredeli and cheese cake factory 2 Min walk. Over all amazing location. You dont need any transportation at all

Reviews.Title: “A great spot in the heart of the city!”
Reviews.Author: melever
Reviews.Content: A relaxed and enjoyable hotel, complete with a Starbucks on the lower level. The staff are all outfitted in ball shirts, which adds to the relaxed atmosphere of this hotel. Free internet connection with wired hook up in the rooms, so those with smart phones or iPads can be found scattered about the lobby and the restaurant picking up WiFi. Location is fantastic and my young kids appreciated the indoor swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HollyBear75
Reviews.Content: We loved it. We ended up here by chance through priceline, and were very pleasantly surprised. The staff was all wearing Cubs/Sox gear, and as Chicago-area people, my friend and I had a great time giving those wearing the "wrong" jerseys (that would be Sox of course) a hard time. The staff was so kind and helpful. The rooms were incredible. Very clean, and exceptionally large for a city hotel. There was a ledge going along an entire wall, which was great to plop stuff down on. Plenty of drawers, and a microwave/fridge too! Beds were super comfortable. The 24-hour little shoping area was great to grab snacks and a bottle of water in the middle of the night. They don't have the typical hotel restaurant, but there was a little cafe, and you could order room service breakfast if you wanted. As an added bonus, Howl at the Moon, where my friends and I had planned to spend most of the evening, was less than a block away. Perfect! I have no complaints whatsoever about this hotel, and will plan to stay there next time I have an overnight/getaway in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Happy With Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: quarterback9
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 nights here over the Memorial Day weekend. We were extremely happy with the entire staff of the hotel. In fact they checked us in, (2 rooms) at 9:00 AM. The doorman or valet, John was so over the top fantastic. We loved seeing him everyday. His great attitude and his helpful tips were fantastic. On our last morning he was searching high and low for a minivan, as we had 4 of us and luggage. He finally got us a chauffered town car at a very reasonable rate to the airport. The room was very acceptable and the bed very comfortable. Previous reviews mention noise from sirens and we did hear that as well but it was part of the sounds of being in the city. The location is great as it is only two blocks from the river and Michigan Ave. There is a nice jazz club directly across the street. All in all, we were happy we picked this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: verypikytraveler123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 1 week for business and leisure purposes, and were glad we did. Check in was very smooth and the front desk clerk, Jason, was very friendly and helpful as well as all the staff. We went up to our 2 double bed suite, on the 11 floor. Our room was very clean and since we had a suite one part of the room was a living area and in another room there was the sleeping area. We are glad we paid the extra 15$ extra a night to have a very nice suite, it was well worth it. The bed was extremely comfortable and the pullout bed in the living area was surprisingly comfortable too. I would ask for a high floor because we could hear all the street traffic and the fire house must have been near the hotel. Once you were asleep it was not that loud that it was wake you up but it didnâ€™t rely matter to us because by the time we got to the hotel room we were all extremely tired anyway. The pool and hot tub were awesome. The hot tub was the rite temp, and it was extremely big and the pool was a nice size too. They had a sauna that I never went it and the workout room was massive with all the workout equipment in the world. We did the Dinning special, you got 25$ a day to spend at the hotel restaurant (which was not very good) and star bucks. We paid an extra 10 dollars a day for this but we never used all of our credits and they did not roll over. They did not take the 25$ off per day, there for they charged our credit card. After 4 calls to the hotel this problem has finally been fixed The location of this hotel is awesome, rite in the middle of everything; it was a block from the red line 2 blocks from the Magnificent Mile, and very close to navy pier! For the price we paid we would return without a doubt. Thanks courtyard Marriot for such an awesome stay!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: lovinghotels86
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my best friend as part of my bachelorette weekend. The location is the only major complaint I had about this hotel.....it was pretty hard to find. Other than that, the staff was very friendly, the rooms clean and spacious, and I loved the fact that there was a starbucks downstairs. We even had our bags held while we went shopping the next day, which was nice of them. There was a man working at the front doors helping with the bags who was very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel during 4th of July Trip”
Reviews.Author: Francisco0126
Reviews.Content: This hotel provided us with a terrific stay and spacious room. The bed was extra comfy. Our room provided us with ample space to set up a pack and play for our daughter. Anyone who uses these things know that while convenient, they can take up a lot of room in small quarters. The service from hotel staff was helpful and provided us with tips on how to get from point A to point B in Chicago expediently. Valet service was greatly appreciated at this location.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: Geary61
Reviews.Content: I stay in Marriott Hotels 80 nights a year. My recent stay at the Courtyard Chicago Downtown/Magnificent Mile was the best experience I have ever had at a Courtyard. The service was excellent. The Front Desk staff was friendly and very helpful. The Bellmen were great at suggesting restaurants and making us reservations. All in all a great experience and I recommend this hotel to both Business and Leisure travelers

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hotel but a noisy location”
Reviews.Author: MacAtlantaGa_
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a business trip. The room was very good. Bed was new and rooms look freshly appointed. My big issue was the noise from the street, which is why I rated the location average. There is a firehouse nearby and you can't miss when they get called out. Breakfast is very average, but what I would expect for a Marriott Courtyard. Hotel staff were very professional. The health club was very surprising for a Courtyard....the best I have ever seen in a Marriott Courtyard. Very large and a lot of equipment.

Reviews.Title: “Snake Bit”
Reviews.Author: 1happygolucky
Reviews.Content: It seems like most everything that could go wrong for me did on my recent three nights stay. No hot water for the first two days. After taking a cold shower the first day, I went to the front desk early the second morning to report the problem, hoping to have it fixed upon my return to the room after breakfast . One hour later and no one had even been sent up to check on it. Another call to the front desk resulted in a visit from Maintenance. He assured me he would have it fixed upon my return later in the day. When I returned 8 hours later, after an exhaustive day, found out I still had no hot water. No note from maintenance, nothing. Finally i insisted on moving rooms. Security was sent up to help me move, but refused to help me take my hanging clothes to the cart, put my toilettes into the suitcase, etc. Upon another call to front desk, they sent another worker that was helpful with my move. Who needs all of this hassle after an exhaustive day. And then I finally got my hot shower. The Ice machines on the four floors I went to search for ice did not work(check earlier reviews for non working ice machines). Upon my arrival to the room, the entrance light was burned out (was fixed properly), the closet light was not working(and never fixed), I put an empty suitcase under the bathroom vanity and found it was soaking wet from a leak presumedly from the sink, as I pulled it out to pack for my trip back home. There were no sheets nor blankets in closet for sleeper sofa- nice to find out at 10 PM and it took three calls to front desk for extra hangers. I, nor they, could get the printers in the lobby to print. They graciously offered me their back office computer. I'm sure they were just as glad to get rid of me as I was to leave. HOPEFULLY OTHER GUESTS WILL HAVE BETTER LUCK THAN I HAD!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and staff! Comfy Beds too!!”
Reviews.Author: travlemore
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! The beds were great! My only complaint was we could here sirens all night long....I don't think I have ever had complete silence at a hotel near magnificent mile. If you go to Chicago, try to get to Tempo for breakfast, you may have to wait 30 mintues or so, but it is well worth it. It is about 1/2 mile from the courtyard marriot.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service almost makes up for Room Quality”
Reviews.Author: londoncal
Reviews.Content: We have always looked to Marriott Courtyard for reliable, attractive accommodations at an attractive price point. This is a site with an excellent location and which offers very attractive pricing compared to nearby hotels, which is understandable because it is in serious need of extensive renovations: Our room smelled musty whenever the air was circulating and we suspected that mold was winning the battle. The bathroom needed new grout, and water pressure was below average. I would not want to stay there again. BUT, while the accommodations were not up to what I would have expected from a Marriott Courtyard, the staff was outstanding ( in comparison to luxury locations) in assistance with getting cabs, storing luggage, directions and recommendations. I just wish the staff had more to work with!

Reviews.Title: “Value!”
Reviews.Author: JMFranklin
Reviews.Content: Boils down to incredibly friendly, genuine staff. The guest service representative was particularly helpful in locating restaurants. Couldn't beat the price. Parking was reasonable, compared to other local hotels, and it's close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & price downtown”
Reviews.Author: samanthajw
Reviews.Content: This Courtyard is a little more upscale than a typical Courtyard. There is valet parking available ($48 - or selfpark $37), a Starbucks and small restaurant inside, and luggage service. We found all the employees very friendly and helpful. The beds were comfortable and the rooms clean. The best part was that it was within walking distance to everything that we had planned for our weekend, so no worries about traffic or parking. Since we booked this on Priceline using "name your own price," we paid a fraction of what we were looking at to book something at regular rates. I will definately consider staying here (or at the Residence Inn or Springhill Suites just down the street) the next time we are in Chicago. If you stay here you must try EATT across the street - great food & prices.

Reviews.Title: “bad luck with my room but the staff were great”
Reviews.Author: sbenus
Reviews.Content: i was here from the 12th - 15th for a conference. i like courtyards but i seemed to have bad luck with the room this time. first, there was no shade in my room. they offered to switch me but as i was settled in and had to get up early each day i declined. second, my tv was good for about 5 mins then went black so they changed it on the 2nd day. third, the adjacent rooms' clock radio started playing ranchero music all night the first 2 nights. they resolved this when i called. as far as i can tell, and i'm tech savvy, these units can't just turn the alarm off so i set mine to turn on when i wasn't there. the staff is where this hotel shines. all very friendly and helpful, especially Ronnie the bellman. it's got a great location as well. if you get a room without issues, it's a good choice

Reviews.Title: “perfect spot for shopping”
Reviews.Author: Edstr
Reviews.Content: We were able to sight see, shop, eat and be in a perfect location

Reviews.Title: “A nice Courtyard with spotty room cleaning”
Reviews.Author: Jeffontheroad
Reviews.Content: I checked in for a conference at this hotel. One plus, even though the hotel was pretty full, they were able to let us check in early. They gave me a room on the top floor with a nice view. This room must have been a former smoking room, because it had a bit of a smell to it. I called the front desk and I think they sprayed something, because it didn't smell quite as bad. The 2nd day the maid failed to show up to clean my room. I had come back to the room with a few clients that evening to find it a mess with the bed unmade. It was sort of embarrassing. I called the front desk; they apologized and asked if they could send someone up to clean it (at 10pm). I told them no, just to make sure they cleaned it the next day. They did offer 5000 marriott points for the trouble, which I would have gladly traded for my room to be clean when it should have been... All I can tell that happened the next day was them pulling the covers up on the bed and new towels. Nothing else was cleaned up and the coffee wasn't replaced. I was telling a coworker who was with me. He said they only made his bed but didn't bother to put the pillows or runner on it. They just left them on the ground. I'm guessing the cleaning staff is either overworked or lazy. Definitely disappointed. I usually tip the maid $3-$5 a night; I wouldn't tip these maids. The location is good, it's nice to have a Starbucks in the lobby, and public transportation to the red line is very easy. If coming back, I might try the other courtyard on Magnificent Mile first, and then this one if nothing better was available.

Reviews.Title: “Great option for a large group”
Reviews.Author: jlnjz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a holiday celebration for our extended family of about 30 people. We booked a block of rooms and the rate was very competetive. The location is good. On a map it seems like it's a long way to the Magnificent Mile Shopping but it really isn't a bad walk and there are plenty of shops nearby. The rooms were very nice and everyone in our group was very happy with the choice

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Centrally Located Family Friendly Hotel In Chicago”
Reviews.Author: RDB27
Reviews.Content: Our experience with the Courtyard Marriott Downtown in Chicago was a happy one. Just off State Street and located near a subway entrance and inexpensive restaurants, it also had many conveniences within the hotel to please. Our king-sized bedroom had wonderful bedding, and a sink separate from the tub/toilet, making it easier to dress while the shower was in use. The magnifying mirror above the sink was appreciated, as was the hair dryer and iron/ironing board. The sofa converted to a full-sized bed, and a refrigerator and microwave were very convenient. A complimentary Internet connection was also a plus. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Although we did not use it, a coin-operated laundry for hotel guests was available. They also have a fitness room and indoor pool. Unfortunately, the usual breakfast buffets no longer exist, and dinner was not available. There is no safe in the room, making it less convenient, since one has to acquire a box at Reception(complimentary). A mirror in the bedroom area was also missed. Despite these little minuses, I would heartily recommend this hotel. The price per room was also excellent, considering we were in downtown Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Great location makes you feel like a true Chicagoan”
Reviews.Author: grannyKCMO
Reviews.Content: I have been to Chicago several times, and this trip made me feel like I really lived there! The hotel was very nice and clean, and it was easy to get to other parts of the city from there. Train to and from Midway - 3 blocks away. Train to Wrigley - just around the corner. It was such an excellent location, really close to fun nightlife, but it also felt like a real neighborhood. I felt very safe in that area. The staff was very helpful and nice. I had asked for an early check in, and the room was ready at 12:30! Nice pool, hot tub and deck area for relaxing after walking around the city. The room was a good size, bed was very comfy and having internet was a nice bonus. My only minor complaint is the water pressure in the shower being a little less powerful than I like. I had no issues with the walls being too thin. Stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Garmentbagger
Reviews.Content: Good hotel overall. The staff was helpful and attentive. Rooms were comfortable and clean enough. We were in Chicago for a trade show and our company occupied 12-14 rooms for the week. The hotel is conveniently located with several restaurants (good variety of cuisines), bars and shopping places within short walking distance. There is also a Starbucks located adjacent to the lobby which several of us found very convenient each day we were there. The only major complaint I had was the NOISE from all the fire trucks, police cars and ambulances (all with sirens blaring) heard throughout the night. Also heard some staggering drunks yelling and carrying-on down on the street around closing time. After the first night of being awaken every hour or so, I located some ear plugs which improved my sleep experience enormously. I strongly suggest bringing a set of soft ear plugs to wear to bed if you are booked into this hotel. Remember the ear plugs and I think most people will be okay with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “MAGNIFICENT HOTEL AT MAGNIFICENT MILE CHICAGO”
Reviews.Author: SylviaUrsula
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Chicago and I had a great working and personal experience. The hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. The location was perfect, with a lot of turist atractions, shopping and restaurants nearby, walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Average at Best”
Reviews.Author: accidental_squirrel
Reviews.Content: This is an ok hotel. Relatively clean, average sized rooms. My room had a refrigerator which was nice. Front desk staff somewhat indifferent. They weren't very knowledgeable as to my Platinum benefits, I guess they don't get a lot of business travel. Only one of four ice machines were working. There is a lot of street noise here. Although I was on the 14th floor, and the hotel has newer windows with the insulated glass, there was constant noise from sirens on the street. I think there must be a hospital or fire station nearby. However, I turned the fan on high and slept ok.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough”
Reviews.Author: Rich01Cards
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a excellent location in downtown Chicago. No complaints about anything related to this hotel. Ok maybe the the valet parking cost of $40+ was excessive but it's downtown Chicago so it's not going to be cheap regardless. We were pleased with our stay over the 4th of July weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay, GREAT location, few mishaps”
Reviews.Author: travelwright2010
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an AMAZING location! The room was okay, it was clean though and affordable which worked for me. One thing to note, if you use your bank card to book the room instead of a credit card, they will charge you up front and extra 20 per day (as a hold on your card) BUT you will be refunded the money after 3 days. Other than that, you're on the same street as Garretts popcorn (1 min walk from the front door) shopping across the street and everything is walking distance (navy pier 4 blocks, hersheys, luma, West Egg Cafe (great breakfast!!) etc) Also, the desk staff (I believe it was Aysha) was GREAT! Very knowlegable about food places and where everything is located from the hotel! The room was regular. Tip to remember, you can request a mini fridge and microwave in your room for no addt'l cost.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal, comfortable, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: siminnyc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Courtyard by Marriott on East Hubbard for 3 nights at the end of June. Great standard Marriott. Comfortable king size bed in a modern large room. The free in room internet is such a great treat. When I first walked to the hotel from across the river from the west, the area looks a bit shabby, but if you go east towards Michigan Avenue, in 3 minutes you are in the middle of everything that the Magnificent Mile has to offer. The hotel doesn't have too much amenities, but I had no use for them anyway. It has a cafe & Starbucks downstairs. A Seven-Eleven, Subway sandwich both in the same building, as well as another Seven-Eleven across the street, and a larger supermarket down the street in a new condo building. This is a great hotel, as long as you are not looking for a 5 star hotel with tons of amenities on site. , rather a great business/casual traveler type hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: msluvcruzin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Courtyard at the corner of Hubbard and State over the 4th of July weekend. As others have mentioned the location is great. It's a block from the Red Line and within a walking distance of many good restaurants. We walked to the Navy Pier but they do have a free trolley shuttle that will take you to and from. It's not far from the Maginficent Mile. We too heard sirens but not to the point to distrupt our sleep. We had an end room with 2 doubles and plenty of space. Parking is $48 for valet. However, there is a self-park at the corner of LaSalle and Kenzie which is much less. It's a few block walk but not bad. Had a good time and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great!”
Reviews.Author: Astorianka
Reviews.Content: Location is key here in Chicago - this hotel is located right in downtown with easy access to anything Chicago could possibly offer. No need for a car - everything is within walking distance, or if you don't like walking - short cab or subway rides. By the way, parking in Chicago is super expensive, $48 per night in this hotel. We got the deal through price negotiator - that is why the value was great! 200-250 might be a bit pricey for its amenities and rooms, but location is key!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and great service”
Reviews.Author: beach_bb
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a few nights recently, the location of the hotel is fantastic. It is near 7/11, grocery store, great restaurants, night life, the train. I walked everywhere. The service was great, you feel welcome from the moment you arrive. I have requested an early check-in and this was not a problem. Free internet access is standard here as well as access to fitness facilities. The bed is very comfortable, comparable to Westin's Heavenly beds. The bathroom is on the small side and bath products are not high end. The room was clean. One thing, the walls were not thin but the door was! i can hear people's conversation in the hallway and the elevator (my room was close to the elevator). If you are a light sleeper, that could be a problem. However I was up early and returned late so that wasn't too much of an issue for me. Cannot comment on the food as I did not eat there, they do have a 24/7 pantry available and a Starbucks on premise.

Reviews.Title: “Professional and Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JaideepMumbai
Reviews.Content: I stayed here only for a day. Its very comfortable hotel and I wish I could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: almostretired42
Reviews.Content: Well located for restaurants and taxis as well as plenty of places to walk to for eating and shopping. Three easy blocks to Chicago's Miracle Mile (Michigan Ave.) And bonus> there is a Starbucks adjacent to the lobby. The in-house cafe next to Starbucks has some great breakfast sandwiches too. Typical Courtyard desk and work chair in room w/usb n wall for computer.

Reviews.Title: “Most uncomfortable rooms ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bacevedo15
Reviews.Content: You have to see these small + uglies bathrooms. Go somewhere else

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE Marriotts, THIS hotel is BAD!!”
Reviews.Author: MommasWings
Reviews.Content: We ONLY stay at Marriott owned hotels, because of their cleanliness, customer service and impeccable reputation. This hotel is the pits! The room was dirty, crumpled papers under the desk...the room needed a good vacuuming. I left a gratuity for Housekeeping, hoping we would return to a cleaned room. When we returned there were a couple almonds laying on the carpet, and crumbs on one of the beds. The only friendly members of the work-staff, I feel, were the Valet Crew. I'd never recommend this hotel, or stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “On the Mile!”
Reviews.Author: tangerinepunch
Reviews.Content: The place has an amazing location! We booked it as a deal with our flight and got a great price. The hotel is right in the middle of downtown and walking distance from the magnificient mile. We could walk to most of the downtown attractions as also see it from the hotel at times. Amazing location indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Everything they do they do well”
Reviews.Author: jahkelley
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because I got a good deal. But it was a real treasure. The location was convenient to both North Michigan Avenue and the Loop. And it was only a block and a half from the CTA Red Line stop at State and Grand. This is not a luxury hotel, so there was not a lot of pampering. But what was there was well planned and very functional. The staff was polite and efficient. The room was arranged well for work, with a large desk and wireless internet. And there were enough electrical outlets for everything, without having to crawl under the desk or move furniture. The lighting was bright enough and placed well for reading. There was a small fridge for drinks or leftovers. The king bed was heavenly, with a down comforter and 6(!) pillows. The view was, well, uninteresting. I was in a room at the back of the hotel, and could only see the other wing of the hotel and the office building across the alley. The ventilation was a little too responsive: I turned the thermostat down when I was going to bed, and instead of the room cooling off by itself, the A/C came on. The workout room, although small, was a real gym, not just a couple of machines installed in a storeroom. (It was shared between the hotel and a residential building) And there was a Starbuck's and a small restaurant (breakfast and lunch only) just off the lobby. A couple of precautions: This is a busy intersection, and there was traffic noise, including sirens. If you are bothered by that, this hotel may not be your best bet. Also, the closest CTA stop has no elevator or escalator. If you're hauling more than you can carry up 2 flights of stairs, you'll need to find another way to get there or walk from a farther station.

Reviews.Title: “Family stay in Queen Double Suite”
Reviews.Author: dee153
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely stay in this hotel. We stayed for 4 nights on the 23rd October 2009. We had a Queen double suite. It was a good size. It had a separate bedroom with 2 Queen beds. The separated living area had a sofa, a microwave, fridge and sink. Both rooms had a big flat screens TV's. It was great to have the space as I was staying with my Mum and sister. Location was perfect. Two blocks from Magnificent Mile. One block from the Metro and 2 blocks from the River. Very easy to get everywhere. There was a Starbucks and the State Street Bread Company for breakfast. We ate in the State Street Bread Breakfast each morning. They had cereals etc along with the usual waffles, pancakes and breakfasts. Averaged $8-$10 each day. There was free wired internet access in the rooms, along with a business centre that had two pc's with internet and printers. (Hading for doing on-line check-in) There is a fire station is a block away but it didn't cause much a problem. Heard one or two fire trucks but it wasn't a problem during the night. I had booked as part of a package on eBookers.com so we got a good rate. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pilot7700
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at the Courtyard-Downtown and was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the staff and accomodations. From the doorman to the maids, all of the staff made our trip extra special. Although the rooms were a little on the small size, they were clean, quiet and comfortable. Hotel food was not all that special, but there are many restaurants within walking distance. Bathrooms were clean. This is a no-complaint hotel. Price for parking is outrageous. ($45/night)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: WesselAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this Courtyard for a total of 6 nights and was really pleased with the hotel. Location's great. Just a 5 min walk from Michagan Av so no inconvenience from the street noises. Front desk staff is really friendly and very service-oriented. Igor, the supervisor, is very helpfull. And don't forget the funny and friendly bellboy (Ronnie was his name I thought). But most of all my king suite was amazing. It was at the end of the hallway and was huge. Nice sitting area with a flatscreen, great boxspring bed with a 2nd flatscreen. Bathroom is well equipped. Free internet connection (with a wire) in the room. I went to the pool twice which was quite good as well. Only disadvantage from the surroundings was the lack of (take-away) restaurants. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: pnl102
Reviews.Content: 1. Staff were exceptionally friendly. 2. Room was fine except that shade would not go up (not that it mattered for me since I was only there at night). 3. Receptivity for my iPhone was terrible. I had to go outside to the sidewalk to make a call. 4. I was disappointed that Fitness Center had no water dispenser.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel with a capable and friendly staff make for a good stay”
Reviews.Author: Cymone_Andre
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Courtyard Downtown River North. The staff was very friendly and the hotel was clean and comfortable. The location, on Hubbard Street near many bars and a short walk from both the Magnificent Mile and the river tours, is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced for the location”
Reviews.Author: UmaKS
Reviews.Content: The Courtyard Marriott Downtown is a wonderful hotel located minutes from most tourist attractions of Chicago. Its location makes it one the best places to stay in Chicago if you are visiting as a tourist. It is located two blocks west of the Mag mile and 2 blocks north of the Chicago river making it possible to walk to the shops and attraction of the Mile as well as to the Millennium park complex. Another plus is the free trolley service from right outside the hotel to the Navy Pier which runs all thru the tourist season. We used this to get to and back from the Navy Pier. But be prepared to wait a while for the trolley to appear. The Hotel has all the standard amenities and our room which had a king bed was a decent size and quite comfortable. The street noise can be a little bothersome on the lower floors. The State Street Bread & Co restaurant attached to the hotel was adequate at best, nothing very special and the full buffet breakfast that we had there was quite pricey nearly 19 $ per head. The hotel staff was very helpful, and accommodated our request for an early check in without a murmur. They also gave us some good suggestion for dining out . There were a few good eating places nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Itâ€™s Okay if Youâ€™re Okay with Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: HonkHonk
